name: Wayman Jones
title: Junior C#/.NET Developer
summary: Junior C#/.NET Developer with hands-on experience building Windows desktop applications, implementing secure authentication, and developing workflow automation features. Experienced with SQL database read/write operations, debugging .NET apps, and supporting production software used internally. Brings strong attention to detail, reliability, rapid learning, and corporate security discipline from Amazon (risk awareness, documentation, communication).

core_skills.languages_frameworks: C#, .NET 6+, WPF, XAML, LINQ, SQL, ADO.NET
core_skills.tools_tech: SQL Server, Visual Studio, Git/GitHub, Windows Presentation Foundation, JSON
core_skills.developer_strengths: Debugging, Clean Coding, UI Logic, Problem-Solving, Learning New Technologies

technical_proficiencies.core_languages: C#, .NET 6+, WPF, XAML, LINQ, SQL, ADO.NET
technical_proficiencies.security_compliance: Role-Based Access Control (application level), Credential Hashing (conceptual), Risk Assessment Awareness
technical_proficiencies.practices: Debugging, Clean Code, Basic Repository Patterns, UI State Management

bullets.text: Implemented secure multi-user login and authentication in a WPF/.NET application, improving role-based access and user security.
Developed clock-in/clock-out tracking features that stored entries in SQL Server, improving employee time tracking accuracy.
Created SQL scripts and queries to support data entry, reporting, and validation in Shift Scheduler.
Performed debugging, XAML UI updates, and production fixes under guidance of senior engineers.
Worked with ADO.NET, interfaces, OOP principles, and basic repository patterns to improve code quality.
Collaborated through GitHub using branches, commits, and pull requests.
Conducted security risk assessments for corporate buildings and documented vulnerabilities.
Enforced access control procedures and supported employee safety protocols.
Produced accurate incident reports and security findings used by management.
Performed inspections, troubleshooting, and repairs on facility equipment.
Demonstrated reliability and attention to detail in supporting city operations.
Built a secure multi-user login system with hashed credentials stored in SQL Server.
Implemented role-based authorization and session handling to improve application security.
Developed data-access methods for retrieving users and updating account settings.
Simplified onboarding by streamlining authentication workflow.

projects.name: Shift Scheduler – Clock In/Out Tracking Module

bullets.text: Designed time-tracking module integrated with SQL database.
Implemented clock-in/clock-out UI logic, business rules, and data validation.
Wrote SQL scripts for inserting, updating, and reporting time entries.
Improved reporting accuracy via consistent storage structure.
Developed console-based CRUD app for time entry management.
Implemented Create, Read, Update, Delete operations using parameterized queries.
Strengthened understanding of connectivity, error handling, modular code.
Built inventory management tool to load, filter, and update product items.
Used LINQ for search, sorting, and real-time UI updates.
Practiced basic MVVM-style separation for maintainability.
Created tables, indexes, and stored procedures to strengthen fundamentals.
Practiced JOINs, filtering, grouping, aggregates.
Simulated business data scenarios for learning.
